Package algorithms.connected

Class ConnectedValuesFinder

java.lang.Object
algorithms.connected.ConnectedValuesFinder
public class ConnectedValuesFinder extends Object
given a set of points, finds the connected among them and places them into groups. note that connected here means adjacent to one another and adjacent is defined by the default "4 neighbor" offsets, but can be overridden to use all 8 neighbors. The runtime complexity is essentially O(N_points).
Author:
nichole

      public void setToUse8Neighbors()

    • findGroups

      public void findGroups(int pixelValue)
      find the groups of connected points in pixIdxs where connected means is adjacent to another point in the group and having this pixelValue. The adjacency by default is using the 4 neighbor pattern search unless the user has set that to 8 neighbors. The runtime complexity is essentially O(pixIdxs.size()).
      Parameters:
      pixelValue -

    • findGroupsNotThisValue

      public void findGroupsNotThisValue(int pixelValue)
      find the groups of connected points in pixIdxs where connected means is adjacent to another point in the group and re any points that do not have this pixelValue. The adjacency by default is using the 4 neighbor pattern search unless the user has set that to 8 neighbors. The runtime complexity is essentially O(pixIdxs.size()).
      Parameters:
      pixelValue -
